neutral.comment: Base neutral color. (Note: Color schemes automatically apply this as the container's background color.)

neutralAlt.comment: Alternative neutral color to be used for subtle, NON-ESSENTIAL, effects.

accent.comment: Accent color for elements that should draw the user's focus.

accentSuccess.comment: Accent color for elements that indicate success or completion.

accentAttention.comment: Accent color for elements that require the user's attention.

accentDanger.comment: Accent color for elements that indicate danger or risk.

neutral.comment: Base neutral color. (Note: Color schemes automatically apply this as the container's foreground color.)

neutralSubtle.comment: Alternative neutral color to be used for non-interactive items that need to visually stand out less against their surroundings.

neutralEmphasis.comment: Alternative neutral color to be used for non-interactive items that need to visually stand out more against their surroundings.

control.comment: Color intended for interactive controls (links, buttons, etc.) that need to be visually distinguishable against their surroundings.

controlAlt.comment: Color intended for an alternative state or type of interactive control. For example, a visited link.

controlEmphasis.comment: Color intended for states of interactive controls that need to be visually emphasised somehow. Typically this will be used for hover and/or focus states.

controlActive.comment: Color intended for the active state of interactive controls.

controlDisabled.comment: Color intended for the disbaled state of interactive controls.

accent.comment: Accent color for elements that should draw the user's focus.

accentSuccess.comment: Accent color for elements that indicate success or completion.

accentAttention.comment: Accent color for elements that require the user's attention.

accentDanger.comment: Accent color for elements that indicate danger or risk.
